title: Lohagad Fort
subtitle: The Iron Fort of Maharashtra
overview: Lohagad Fort, meaning 'Iron Fort', stands proudly near Lonavala in the Pune district of Maharashtra. It is one of the best-preserved and most accessible forts in the Sahyadri range, located at an altitude of 3,389 feet.
Known for its impressive fortifications and scenic trekking routes, Lohagad served as an important stronghold of the Maratha Empire under Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

highlights.title: Imposing Structure
highlights.description: Lohagad’s solid architecture and iron-like strength earned it the name ‘Iron Fort’.

highlights.title: Popular Trekking Destination
highlights.description: A favorite weekend trek near Lonavala, offering an easy climb with rewarding views.

geography.intro: Located about 52 km from Pune and 11 km from Lonavala, Lohagad Fort divides the basins of Indrayani and Pavna rivers. The fort’s walls still stand strong, overlooking the lush valleys of the Western Ghats.

details.label: Built By
details.value: Satavahanas, later strengthened by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj

climate.description: The fort experiences pleasant weather most of the year, with monsoon being the most scenic season.

seasons.text: Monsoon (June–September): The fort becomes lush green and mist-covered.
Winter (October–February): Ideal time for trekking and photography.

geography.conclusion: Lohagad’s geographic location made it a watchpoint over the trade routes between the Konkan coast and the Deccan Plateau.

activities.title: Trekking
activities.description: The Lohagad trek is an easy and scenic route starting from the base village Malavali.

activities.title: Photography
activities.description: Capture misty monsoon clouds, lush greenery, and the panoramic view of Pawna Lake.
info: Best views during early morning or sunset.

activities.title: Fort Exploration
activities.description: Explore ancient gates, strong walls, and the famous Vinchu Kata (Scorpion’s Tail) point.
info: Vinchu Kata offers spectacular valley views.
Spot old cannons and stone water tanks.

attractions.title: Vinchu Kata (Scorpion’s Tail)
attractions.description: A long, narrow fortified spur resembling a scorpion’s tail offering breathtaking views of the valley.

attractions.title: Ganesh Darwaja
attractions.description: One of the four grand entrances to the fort, built with strong stone arches and carvings.

attractions.title: Pawna Lake Viewpoint
attractions.description: A perfect spot for photography with mesmerizing views of Pawna Dam and Tung Fort.

marineLife.intro: Though located in the mountains, Lohagad Fort is surrounded by rich biodiversity and lush vegetation.

items.title: Flora
items.description: Thick green cover during monsoon with wildflowers, shrubs, and moss-covered stones.

items.title: Fauna
items.description: Monkeys, peacocks, and numerous bird species can be spotted along the trail.

conclusion: The fort and surrounding areas form part of the Western Ghats biodiversity hotspot.
Perfect for eco-trekkers and bird watchers.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: From Pune: 52 km via Old Mumbai-Pune Highway.
From Lonavala: 11 km drive to the base village Malavali.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest station: Malavali (2 km from base).
Local trains available from Pune and Lonavala.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest airport: Pune International Airport (64 km).
Taxis and cabs available from Pune to Malavali.

bookingTips.description: Start early to enjoy mist-free views before the fog rolls in.
Wear good trekking shoes as the steps can be slippery during rains.
Carry waterproof bags for cameras and gadgets during monsoon.
